Description: Foot sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with trace of bowl; white slip; interior: glazed black in tondo with rosette in added red and added white; exterior: bowl reserved, foot glazed (fired red and worn) with two white bands above frieze of white downward rays; underside reserved with fugitive white slip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Decorated chalice feet are rare. For other decorated Chalice Style feet, see Lemos nos 1200 and 1201 from Gordion. See also British Museum 1924,1201.561, UCL 156 and Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.54.1894.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 91)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1169) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL np 41 (Other Accession Number)
